name: Amethyst Inn at Sarah's Garden

reviews.title: Jane and Rocky wonderful, but the inn is outdated and dirty
reviews.text: Jane and Rocky are very hospitable and wonderful people; however, the first room my new husband and I were taken to had a palmetto bug in it (read: variety of cockroach) that "flew in from the trees." The second room had a pair of pliers in it near the window air conditioner, broken slates in the doors to the closet and tape holding up the wallpaper in the bathroom. Although we felt bad having to check out early, I saw another bug and couldn't stay there comfortably. The place needs updating and a thorough bath (there were dust mites all over the fake flowers in the hallway). However, I must say that Jane and Rocky were very understanding and only charged us the one night for the room. I am just a freak about bugs, but apparently, they are all over Savannah. (Regardless of that statement, I didn't see them at anywhere else we stayed)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had originally booked a room at a LaQuinta since we have a large, but excellent, dog. At the last minute, we wanted to stay closer to the historic district and were referred to Amythst Inn. This is a lovely inn and the hosts, Rocky and Jane, were great. Since we had a dog, we had the lower level room and it was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast the next morning was also delicious. I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great Hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well all, this is our second trip to the Amethyst Inn. My husband Rich and I loved Savannah and especially the Amethyst Inn so much in April that we had to come for our wedding anniversary last week. We were very excited to see our inn keepers Rocky and Jane again, it felt like we came home. Truely they are so accomodating and inviting and the B&B is beautiful, that you feel like you're home. Rocky and Jane are very informative on everything Savannah.
reviews.title: Our Second Home at this Beautiful B&B!!!!!
Loved the Amethyst Inn
reviews.text: Every morning you wake up to a delicious and variety filled breakfast and at 4:00p it's cocktail time complete with snacks, where the fun and conversation with other guests is found.
We now have extended family in a place we also call home and we're looking forward to our next trip back there.
reviews.title: Loved it.

reviews.text: It is our 3rd time in 2 years here....and it's better than ever. Rocky and Jane are gracious hosts, the food is great, the Victorian decor beautiful and the cleaniless perfect. On this our 3rd visit, we invited friends, who hold the same opinion. We travel all over the world, live in London half the year (so see ALOT of places).... what;s not to like? We tried another B&B last spring when Sarahs Garden was fully booked as were really sorry. We love it...try it!
reviews.title: Thiis place is Great! 3rd visit a charm.....again.
NOT nice
reviews.text: We hated this place. We checked out early and we never do that! Our room was smelly, dirty, the shower had mold, the hand soap had the most awful pungent scent. Don't know if the owners were nice because we never saw them. The carpets were dirty. The couch in our room was dirty. Everything was dusty. And to top it all off there was an envelope for us to leave a tip for the housekeeper (didn't do that). Don't stay here! You will regret it!
the amethyst Inn is quite a nice house with nice furnitures.the location is not the greatest as it is at the edge of the historic district and you need a car to get around.
reviews.title: not too good

likes.liked: — breakfast, price,no sevice to talk about

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the first B&B we stayed at during our ten days trip and it was also the poorest one . The owners did not live on the premise so it was hard to find out information. You had to call them. The staff changed daily and the breakfast is not worth mentioning.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway
Jane and Rocky were VERY nice, but..................
reviews.text: We have learned that there is an association of select Registry distinguished inns of the north america.. I would suggest that before you book a B&B in the states and Canada you see if they belong to that group. Our experience was ,that the one B&B we stayed in later on ,which was registered with select registry was by far better than the others we stayed in for the same price.I saw in the book that there are a few B&B in Savannah which are listed in the select registry, I wish I would have known.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to Savannah, which included two nights at the Amethyst Inn. Staying in a period home in the historic district enhanced our experience, and the inn was welcoming, comfortable and clean. The owners -- a caring and helpful couple -- live elsewhere in Savannah in a house more suitable for raising their daughter, but come to the inn during the day and are always available by phone. Since we like to walk, we had no problem with the location, which is toward the edge of the historic district, and we appreciated their off-street parking.
reviews.title: nice inn but disappointing breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one disappointment was breakfast. At a B&B we expect the breakfast to be a special experience or at least an abundant buffet so people with varying tastes and restrictions could be satisfied, but both mornings a handful of dishes were put out, including a bowl of grits and some Southern (greasy) meat. One of the days there was a small quiche-type casserole, which was good but too small to feed all the guests. The cook was willing to prepare eggs on request but they were swimming in butter or some other fat. The bread one day was refrigerator-type rolls with sickly sweet icing and the other day cold, toasted commercial cinnamon bread. There were a few boxed cereals plus sweet homemade granola. But the nail in the coffin was canned fruit. Why, in this day of always accessible sweet fresh pineapple, a B&B charging $200/night would serve canned pineapple rings is beyond me. I appreciate their not wanting to have leftover food that must be tossed, but a large bowl of fresh fruit salad could last for days and be replenished as needed.
reviews.title: great southern charm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Amethyst Inn is one we will never forget. The people there were wonderfull from booking dinner & tour reservations to making sure that our every need was met. This is a place in which we will be returning to over & over again.
reviews.title: Great get-away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay in Savannah, Ga. and it had to do a lot with where we stayed. We really enjoyed staying in such a historical inn with so much history. Jane and Rocky were great to get to know and made our trip one that we will never forget. The whole staff treated us like royalty. The food was fantastic from southern style biscuits and sausage gravy to banana french toast. We certainly enjoyed meeting the other guests at the 5pm wine socials. It was just a wonderful time and we would recommend it to anyone travelling to Savannah. Jane recommended some wonderful resturants that were quite up our "alley". We will be staying with them from now on when we travel back to Savannah. I wish them very much success and hope we will see them soon
reviews.title: A Beautiful Property & Very Enjoyable Experience

likes.liked: — Attractive rooms and decor; breakfast and evening appetizers.

reviews.title: Wonderful Experience
reviews.text: Really like visiting Savannah, having done so many times over the years; and, have stayed in downtown hotels as well as B&B's on previous trips. Staying at the Amethyst Inn made this latest trip an especially enjoyable visit to Savannah. It is a lovely and charming home, and it is maintained in beautiful condition. Our accomodations were very spacious, clean, well-furnished, and decorated in a very attractive way. Old-fashioned Victorian decor, but with things like bathroom facilities new and modern - just as we like them. The breakfast spread was terrific each morning, and the early evening fare (appetizers, etc.) was a nice touch to provide some light fare and socializing, before guests headed out to dine at nearby Savannah restaurants. Mr. and Mrs. Reed are wonderful hosts, and both are very outgoing in making guests feel like welcome friends in their home. We found the Amethyst Inn to provide very wonderful value for the money we spent; and, highly recommend it for folks looking to enjoy staying in a B&B in a nice part of Savannah's historic district.

Nice place to stay, very clean and friendly. The room temps, food and shortbread was great. The staff was very helpful in planning the day and sharing your experiences with you. Gave great referrals for taxis. restraunts and experiences. Word of advice
reviews.title: girls weekend out

reviews.text: if you have hard time climbing stairs, this may not be a good pick
reviews.title: Disappointed
I love this place!
reviews.text: stairs inside and outside are very steep.Chemise, jane, and lindsey were awesome

reviews.title: Great Hospitality Loved this Inn
reviews.text: We found this B & B on line and read the reviews on trip advisor which were pretty good. We were disappointed. The owners Rocky and Jane are very nice and do a good job at helping you arrange tours and restaurants. The Inn itself needs some up-dating. We stayed in the 2 lowers level suites- The Ivy and Hydrangea rooms. When we arrived we came in the back entrance which had broken chairs sitting there and old rugs. We were greeted one live and one dead cockroach in our rooms. Several lights were broken and carpeting in the Hydrangea room is dirty and old. The silk flower arrangements are old and worn. There still was a St Paddy's day leprecon in the arrangement and an christmas candle on the outside patio table. The patio umbrellas were old and frayed. The day to day operations of the house are overseen by 3 college girls. One does the cooking, another the cleaning, etc. I don't think college kids pay attention to the small details needed at a B & B. "Sarah's garden" was over grown and needed some attention.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am not sure if Rocky and Jane are just tired or are financially unable to keep the Inn updated but it is in need of most real attention. We staying in the downstairs suites so can't address the upstairs room- however one couple did go upstairs to their room and then proceeded to come down and proceeded to check out. Did go to the Sweet Water Spa and have wonderful spa treatments. They did a great job! Overall liked Savannah but would choose different lodging next time.
reviews.title: Amethyst is a Gem

aka: Amethyst Inn At Sarah`s Garden Hotel Savannah
